etymology.description: 阜(阜) (fù, "mound") + 侌(侌) (yīn, "hidden") = indication of terrain like hills providing shade -> concept of "shade" or "shadow"
etymology.interpretation: The character 陰 (yīn, "shade") combines 阜(阜) (fù, "mound") indicating terrain features, with 侌(侌) (yīn, "hidden") conveying the idea of concealment, to represent areas shaded by hills or mountains.
etymology.simplification: 陰 was simplified to 阴 by replacing 阜(阜) (fù, "mound") with 阝, a simpler component representing the same idea.

examples.chinese: 树下有阴凉(樹下有陰涼)。
examples.english: There is cool shade under the tree.

examples.chinese: 在阴影下(在陰影下)，人们可以暂时躲避烈日(人們可以暫時躲避烈日)。
examples.pinyin: Zài yīn yǐng xià, rén men kě yǐ zàn shí duǒ bì liè rì.
examples.english: Under the shade, people can temporarily escape the scorching sun.
